Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of US-Guided Steroid Injections in de Quervain Disease

Trial_Design.evidence: A sample size of 21 per group was calculated to provide 80% power to detect a clinically important difference of 20 mm in VAS score.

Participants.evidence: 50 patients with de Quervain disease and complete intracompartmental septum were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive US-guided injections in both subcompartments (n = 25) or the EPB subcompartment alone (n = 25)

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial evaluated the effectiveness and safety of US-guided steroid injections

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was pain reduction measured by VAS score at 6 weeks.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 50 patients with de Quervain disease and complete intracompartmental septum were randomised

Harms.evidence: No adverse events such as tendon rupture or infections occurred.
